citations.narrative:
The registrant does not have documentation of Contingency Plan training for all employees. Without training on the
Contingency Plan, personnel may not be aware of their roles and responsibilities in the event of an emergency or
disaster; animals may suffer illness, injury or death due to unpreparedness. The registrant must provide and document
training for its personnel regarding their roles and responsibilities as outlined in the Contingency Plan and ensure that new
personnel receive this training within 30 days of their start date.
TO BE CORRECTED BY AUGUST 27, 2023

Ten adult, Holstein cows are housed in an outdoor pen without access to shade.
Prolonged exposure to direct sunlight can cause overheating that can result in discomfort, illness or death for the animals.
The registrant must ensure that sufficient shade is provided, by natural or artificial means, to allow all animals kept
outdoors to protect themselves when direct sunlight is likely to cause overheating or discomfort.
TO BE CORRECTED BY CLOSE OF BUSINESS ON 07/28/2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
